snippet: “Don’t Mess With Texas,” the trademarked slogan, has become something far bigger: an identity statement, and the state is touchy about who uses it and how.
abstract: Trademarked slogan 'Don’t Mess With Texas,' started nearly 30 years ago as a clarion call of campaign to reduce littering, has become something far bigger, now acting as an identity statement and a declaration of Texas swagger; state in recent years has initiated legal battles to protect what it now sees as a trademark to be used only with authorization.
lead_paragraph: “Don’t Mess With Texas,” the trademarked slogan, has become something far bigger: an identity statement, and the state is touchy about who uses it and how.

headline.main: Not to Be, Um, Trifled With, Texas Guards Its Slogans
headline.print_headline: Not to Be, Um, Trifled With, Texas Guards Its Slogans
